title: Hedging carbon risk with a network approach
abstract: arXiv:2311.12450v2 Announce Type: replace  Abstract: Sustainable investing refers to the integration of environmental and social aspects in investors' decisions. We propose a novel methodology based on the Triangulated Maximally Filtered Graph and node2vec algorithms to construct an hedging portfolio for climate risk, represented by various risk factors, among which the CO2 and the ESG ones. The CO2 factor is strongly correlated consistently over time with the Utility sector, which is the most carbon intensive in the S&P 500 index. Conversely, identifying a group of sectors linked to the ESG factor proves challenging. As a consequence, while it is possible to obtain an efficient hedging portfolio strategy with our methodology for the carbon factor, the same cannot be achieved for the ESG one. The ESG scores appears to be an indicator too broadly defined for market applications. These results support the idea that bank capital requirements should take into account carbon risk.

translated_title: 基于网络方法的碳风险套期保值
translated_abstract: 可持续投资指的是在投资者决策中整合环境和社会方面的因素。我们提出了一种基于三角形最大过滤图和node2vec算法的新方法，用于构建一个碳风险套期保值组合，代表了各种风险因素，其中包括CO2和ESG。CO2因子在长期内与实用程序部门存在强烈的相关性，后者是标普500指数中最碳密集的部门。相反，识别与ESG因子相关的一组部门证明是具有挑战性的。因此，尽管可以利用我们的方法获得碳因子的有效套期保值组合策略，但对于ESG因子却无法实现。ESG得分似乎是一种对市场应用过于宽泛定义的指标。这些结果支持了银行资本要求应该考虑碳风险的观点。
tldr: 使用 Triangulated Maximally Filtered Graph 和 node2vec 算法构建碳风险套期保值组合，并发现CO2因子与实用程序部门强相关，但对ESG因子的套期保值策略较难实现。
en_tdlr: Constructing a hedging portfolio for climate risk using Triangulated Maximally Filtered Graph and node2vec algorithms, finding strong correlation between CO2 factor and Utility sector, while facing challenges in hedging strategy for ESG factor.
